Articles.Content: I've been working on an interior for the CrewTank since last night. However, I'm having alignment problems. I managed to get it pretty well aligned when the CrewTank was attached to a mk1 pod, but as soon as I attach it to any other command capsule, it fails horribly and goes completely out of alignment. So, basically, I'd like to find out if this is a bug in KSP, and multiple interiors are impossible at the current time; or if I'm simply doing something wrong.

Hmm here try this, This is my CFG edit that holds 3 and has the Shuttle Cockpit Interior

http://www./?b9dbftnr5o2ebr3

Ok, yeah, KSP definitely doesn't handle multiple interiors correctly. I modified an ORDA pod to use its matching interior, and stacked it with a matching regular command pod, upside-down. The interiors intersect quite severely.

Nope, this has major issues. We ran into this when trying to have an empty but crewable rover with an interior, to place on a normal rocket with a command pod. The orientation is screwed.
